page.title: 05Heating the homes in Laggan
page.content: The fast flowing streams of the Monadhliath mountains provide a vast amount of Hydro-Electric power for all of Britain and every house in Laggan has electricity.Despite this many people use wood and peat which they harvest themselves.Coal is brought from the Newtonmore merchants 8 miles away.Although a few homes have installed oil-fired central heating.The 1985 price of oil makes this a very expensive form of heating.Bottled propane and butane gas is available from the local shop (see trade)and is used for cooking and heating.It would be safe to say that wood and peat smoke can be scented readily around 5o'clock each evening as the stoves are stoked to prepare the home for warmth and the evening meal.
